page.title: 18LOCAL CHARACTERS
page.content: As part of the preparations for the school's Centenary Year contact was made with many ex-scholars,some of whom still live locally.They had many tales to tell of Leigh Sinton village in the past.The oldest ex-pupil we traced was 91 year old Miss Annie Ball who vividly remembered receiving the prize she showed us.Her memories of Mr.F.Wareham, the Headmaster from 1894 -1931 were matched by another ex-pupil who can remember hiding and burning the cane of the headmaster and boasted of his feat at Centenary Day.In a photograph of 1907 Miss Ball is pictured standing next to the mother of our present day wheelwright,Gerald Jones,who is a mine of information regarding the village.A famous village character who died 3 years ago is to be remembered by the provision of o seat for the children of the school.
